j:AppellateCase.description: A single case heard by the Court of Appeals (Intermediate Court of Appeal) or Supreme Court (The Court of Last Resort). This case does not retry the original case but determines whether the original case was tried properly and the defendant

j:AppellateCaseOriginalCase.description: An original case that is being retried in an appellate court.

j:AppellateCaseType.description: A data type for a single case heard by a court to determine if the original case was tried properly and the defendant received a fair trial.

appellate:CaseAugmentation.description: Additional information specific to appellate cases.

bankruptcy:CaseAugmentation.description: Additional information specific to bankruptcy cases.

citation:CaseAugmentation.description: A charge issued by a law enforcement officer for a violation requiring the person charged to plead guilty to the charge or to appear in court to contest the charge.  A citation is issued in lieu of an arrest and booking.  Violations are a subset of charges for which a law enforcement officer is authorized to issue a citation in lieu of arrest and booking.  Examples:  traffic ticket, parking ticket or ticket issued for some other ordinance violation such as barking dog or illegal dumping.

civil:CaseAugmentation.description: Information required to initiate a new civil case in a court.  Civil includes conservatorships, guardianships, mental health and probate.

criminal:CaseAugmentation.description: Information required to initiate a new criminal case in a court.  Criminal includes felonies and misdemeanors.

domestic:CaseAugmentation.description: Information required to initiate a new domestic case in a court.  Domestic includes divorces, legal separations, annulment, child custody and visitation, paternity, child support, and domestic violence cases.

criminal:SentenceAugmentation.description: A sentence associated with a specific charge in a case. A sentence may have multiple components (prison, probation, post-incarceration supervision/probation fine, etc.).

j:SentenceCharge.description: A specific charge in a court case resulting in a sentence.

j:SentenceDescriptionText.description: A description of the sentence being imposed.

j:SentenceTerm.description: A duration of a sentence. Specified as either a specific term in days-months-years or as a minimum - maximum range.

j:SupervisionFineAmount.description: A pecuniary criminal punishment or penalty payable to the public treasury

nc:ActivityDisposition.description: A result or outcome of an activity.

nc:ActivityIdentification.description: An identification that references an activity.

nc:CaseDisposition.description: An outcome or processing of a case.

j:SeverityLevelDescriptionText.description: A narrative description of a severity level assigned to a charge.

j:SeverityLevelType.description: A data type for a sentencing guideline severity level assigned to a charge by a judge or supervising agency.

j:SeverityLevelDescriptionText.description: A narrative description of a severity level assigned to a charge.

j:Statute.description: A unique identifier of a law, rule, or ordinance within a jurisdiction.

j:StatuteCodeIdentification.description: An identification number of a set of laws for a particular jurisdiction.

j:StatuteCodeSectionIdentification.description: An identification of a section or category within a code book.

j:StatuteJurisdiction.description: An area in which a statute applies.

j:StatuteLevelText.description: A level of crime a statute applies to.

j:StatuteOffenseIdentification.description: An identification of a criminal offense within a code book.

j:StatuteType.description: A data type for a law, rule, or ordinance within a jurisdiction.

j:StatuteCodeIdentification.description: An identification number of a set of laws for a particular jurisdiction.

j:StatuteCodeSectionIdentification.description: An identification of a section or category within a code book.

j:StatuteJurisdiction.description: An area in which a statute applies.

j:StatuteLevelText.description: A level of crime a statute applies to.

j:StatuteOffenseIdentification.description: An identification of a criminal offense within a code book.

j:SubjectIdentification.description: An assigned identification that identifies a subject.

j:SubjectSupervision.description: An incarceration, detention, or other form of supervision a subject is currently undergoing.

j:SubjectType.description: A data type for a person or organization that is involved or suspected of being involved in a violation of a criminal statute, ordinance or rule.

citation:SubjectAugmentation.description: A person named in a citation alleged to have violated a statute or ordinance.

ecf:SubjectAugmentation.description: A person or organization alleged or found to have committed a crime or violation.

j:SubjectIdentification.description: An assigned identification that identifies a subject.

j:SubjectSupervision.description: An incarceration, detention, or other form of supervision a subject is currently undergoing.

nc:RoleOfPerson.description: A person of whom the role object is a function.

j:SupervisionFineAmount.description: A pecuniary criminal punishment or penalty payable to the public treasury

j:TermType.description: A data type for a duration length either in specific terms or as a range.

nc:ActivityDisposition.description: A result or outcome of an activity.

nc:ActivityIdentification.description: An identification that references an activity.

nc:CaseDisposition.description: An outcome or processing of a case.

j:VehicleModelCode.description: A specific design or class of vehicle made by a manufacturer.

j:ViolatedStatuteAssociationType.description: A data type for an association of a statute that has been violated and other information.

j:Statute.description: A unique identifier of a law, rule, or ordinance within a jurisdiction.

j:WarrantExtraditionLimitationCode.description: A kind of limitation placed on the extradition of a subject from an area outside the immediate jurisdiction of the issuing court.

j:WarrantType.description: A data type for an authorization for an enforcement official to perform a specified action.

j:WarrantExtraditionLimitationCode.description: A kind of limitation placed on the extradition of a subject from an area outside the immediate jurisdiction of the issuing court.

nc:ActivityDisposition.description: A result or outcome of an activity.

nc:ActivityIdentification.description: An identification that references an activity.

nc:CaseDisposition.description: An outcome or processing of a case.
